name: Centaurs
description: Centaurs have the upper body of a human and the lower body of a horse, representing a blend of humanoid and animal traits.
memorable: Centaurs are known for their speed, archery skills, and deep connection to nature, often serving as protectors of the wild.
goals: Centaurs typically aim to protect their forest or plain homes and uphold their independence.
relations: Centaurs may be seen as allies to other fey creatures or anyone who respects nature, but they do not submit easily to authority.
environment: Centaurs are often found in large herds in forests or plains.
strengths: Centaurs boast high strength and dexterity, taking advantage of their agility and physical attacks.
weaknesses: They may struggle in situations requiring high intelligence or charisma due to average mental attributes.
attacks: Centaurs are formidable in both melee and ranged combat, utilizing hooves, pikes, and shortbows with great effectiveness.
most_powerful_ability: Their Trampling Charge allows them to knock opponents prone, setting them up for additional attacks.
senses: Centaurs have a passive perception of 17, allowing them to notice hidden threats and navigate their surroundings effectively.
skills: Centaurs are proficient in nature, perception, and survival, indicating their capability as guardians of the wild.
additional_information: Centaurs exhibit Monstrosity Resilience, resisting exhaustion and frightened conditions.
They can perform Multiattacks, making multiple strikes in a turn.
The Deadeye Shot ability allows them to make a precise ranged attack once per day.
Centaurs prefer to engage in open ground where they can leverage their speed and movement.
Their proud demeanor leads to fierce loyalty to their herds and territories.
test_queries: forest protector that fights with bow
fast creature with powerful charge attack
strong centaur skilled in nature and survival
proud centaur that resists fear effects
